Name: Taj Mahal
Type: Historical Monument / UNESCO World Heritage Site
Nearest Bus Stand: Idgah Bus Stand / Agra ISBT (approx. 6–8 km)
Timings: Opens 30 minutes before sunrise — closes 30 minutes before sunset; closed on Fridays
Accessibility: Well-paved paths; wheelchair access at some entrances
Guided Tours: Local guides available (Hindi/English); audio guide and official counter
Parking: Paid parking available near the complex
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, restaurants, souvenir markets, restrooms, info counters in Agra
Special Notes: One of the New Seven Wonders and UNESCO WHS; prebook tickets.

Name: Agra Fort
Nearest Bus Stand: Idgah Bus Stand / Agra ISBT (approx. 5–7 km)
Accessibility: Large complex with uneven pathways; partial wheelchair access
Guided Tours: Local guides available (Hindi/English); ASI info boards
Parking: Nearby paid parking at approaches
Special Notes: Huge red-sandstone fort with palaces and mosques; offers good Taj views.

Name: Fatehpur Sikri
Accessibility: Large stone courtyards and steps; not fully wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides available; audio guide options via private operators
Parking: Public parking near the complex; nominal charges
Nearby Amenities: Local eateries, guides, small shops; Agra has full services
Special Notes: Once the Mughal capital under Akbar — Buland Darwaza is iconic.

Name: Itmad-ud-Daulah (Baby Taj)
Accessibility: Small gardens with pathways; mixed accessibility
Guided Tours: Local guides available
Parking: Street/public parking nearby
Special Notes: Fine pietra dura work — often called "Baby Taj".

Name: Kashi Varanasi — Ghats & Ganga Aarti
Nearest Bus Stand: Varanasi City Bus Stands / ISBT (approx. 3–6 km)
Nearest Airport: Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport (Varanasi) (approx. 24 km)
Timings: Ghats are public 24/7; Ganga Aarti usually at sunset
Entry Fee: No entry fee for ghats; boat rides charged separately
Accessibility: Many ghats have steps; limited wheelchair access
Guided Tours: Plenty of local guides offering tours in Hindi/English and boat tours
Parking: Limited near older parts; paid parking at some ghats/roads
Nearby Amenities: Temples, guesthouses, hotels, eateries, tea stalls, boatmen services, shops
Special Notes: Varanasi is one of the world's oldest living cities; evening Ganga Aarti is a major cultural spectacle.

Name: Kashi Vishwanath Temple
Nearest Airport: Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport (approx. 24–25 km)
Timings: Varies (typically early morning to late evening)
Entry Fee: No general entry fee; special services may have charges
Accessibility: Narrow lanes; not easily wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Priests and guides available; language support varies
Parking: Very limited in old city area; use distant parking
Nearby Amenities: Pilgrim lodging, eateries, shops for religious items
Special Notes: One of the holiest Shiva temples; new corridor development.

Name: Sarnath
Nearest Airport: Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport (approx. 28–30 km)
Accessibility: Well-kept park and museum areas; moderate accessibility
Guided Tours: Local guides and audio guides available; Buddhist tour groups common
Parking: Parking available near the site
Special Notes: Site of Buddha’s first sermon — major for Buddhist pilgrims.

Name: Ramnagar Fort
Nearest Airport: Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport (approx. 30 km)
Accessibility: Riverbank access, some stairs inside fort; partial accessibility
Guided Tours: Local guides available
Parking: Nearby parking on approach roads
Special Notes: Museum houses vintage cars and royal memorabilia.

Name: Bara Imambara (Asafi Imambara)
Nearest Airport: Chaudhary Charan Singh International Airport, Lucknow (approx. 20 km)
Entry Fee: Small entry fee for monument / guided access
Accessibility: Large courtyards but inner labyrinth involves stairs; partial wheelchair access
Guided Tours: Local guides available in Hindi/English
Parking: Nearby paid parking; auto/rickshaw access common
Special Notes: Famous Bhul Bhulaiya (labyrinth) and Asafi Mosque; major Lucknow attraction.

Name: Rumi Darwaza
Nearest Airport: Chaudhary Charan Singh International Airport (approx. 20 km)
Accessibility: Situated in busy city area; nearby pavements; outer area accessible
Guided Tours: City walking tours include Rumi Darwaza
Parking: Street parking / paid lots nearby
Special Notes: Iconic gateway built under Nawab Asaf-ud-Daula; symbol of Lucknow.

Name: Chota Imambara
Nearest Airport: Chaudhary Charan Singh International Airport (approx. 20–22 km)
Accessibility: Inner areas have stairs and carpets; partial access externally
Guided Tours: Guides available locally
Parking: Nearby parking and rickshaw access
Special Notes: Known for ornate interiors and chandeliers.

Name: Mathura — Shri Krishna Janmabhoomi & Temples
Entry Fee: No general entry fee; special services may have fees
Accessibility: Temple lanes are older and narrow; mobility challenging in crowds
Guided Tours: Local guides and priest-led explanations available
Parking: Near main temple complexes parking available but limited
Special Notes: Birthplace of Lord Krishna; heavy pilgrim traffic during Janmashtami & Holi.

Name: Vrindavan — Banke Bihari Temple / ISKCON
Timings: Temples follow multiple darshan / aarti timings
Entry Fee: No general entry fee; donations customary
Accessibility: Narrow lanes and crowded temple premises; limited wheelchair access
Guided Tours: Local guides & pilgrim tour operators
Parking: Local paid parking near main temple clusters
Nearby Amenities: Guesthouses, eateries serving satvik food, shops
Special Notes: Krishna devotional hub with many temples & festivals (Holi, Janmashtami).

Name: Ayodhya — Ram Janmabhoomi Complex
Entry Fee: No general entry fee; special services may have charges
Accessibility: New infrastructure improved access; central complex has stepped areas
Guided Tours: Local guides available; many pilgrimage packages include guides
Parking: Designated parking zones & e-rickshaws within city
Special Notes: Site considered the birthplace of Lord Rama; major development upgrades.

Name: Prayagraj (Allahabad) — Triveni Sangam & Sangam Ghats
Timings: Accessible round the clock; specific ghat activities vary
Entry Fee: No general entry fee; boat rides chargeable
Accessibility: Ghats have steps; wheelchairs difficult in some areas
Guided Tours: Local guides / priests available; tour operators
Parking: Nearby paid parking in city approaches
Special Notes: Site of historic Magh Mela / Kumbh gatherings; huge pilgrim footfall.

Name: Kushinagar
Entry Fee: Temple complex: generally free; museum may have fees
Accessibility: Well-developed Buddhist circuit with paved approaches; moderate accessibility
Guided Tours: International pilgrims common; guides available in many languages
Parking: Parking available near monasteries and museum
Special Notes: Believed to be where Buddha attained Mahaparinirvana.

Name: Dudhwa National Park
Type: Wildlife Sanctuary / National Park / Tiger Reserve
Nearest Bus Stand: Palia Kalan bus connectivity (approx. local distances)
Accessibility: Road access; safari zones require moderate walking sometimes
Guided Tours: Forest department guides and jeep safaris available
Parking: Parking available at designated entry points
Nearby Amenities: Eco-resorts, lodges, basic shops and eateries
Special Notes: Home to tigers, rhinos and rich biodiversity; Vistadome train safari introduced.

Name: Chitrakoot Dham
Entry Fee: No general entry fee; some sites/temples may have donations
Accessibility: Hilly terrain in spots; many temples require walking; partial accessibility
Guided Tours: Local guides available; pilgrimage tour packages common
Parking: Available in town and near main temples
Nearby Amenities: Guesthouses, eateries, shops for religious items
Special Notes: Important in Ramayana tradition — many temples, ghats and caves.

Name: Jhansi Fort & Rani Mahal
Accessibility: Fort involves climbing; not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides available
Parking: Parking near approaches
Special Notes: Associated with Rani Lakshmibai and 1857 rebellion.

Name: Bithoor (Kali & Brahmavart)
Nearest Bus Stand: Kanpur bus stands & Bithoor local buses (approx. 20–25 km)
Timings: Temples and ghats open morning to evening
Accessibility: Small town, boat/ghat areas; moderate walking
Guided Tours: Local guides available
Parking: Limited; use Kanpur as base
Special Notes: Associated with Indian freedom history and Ramayana references.

Name: Vindhyachal — Vindhyavasini Temple & Scenic Spots
Timings: Temple opening hours typical for Hindu temples
Accessibility: Hill approaches, steps to temple; moderate difficulty
Guided Tours: Local guides available; pilgrimage packages offered
Parking: Available at approaches and parking lots
Special Notes: Famous for Navratri pilgrimage & Vindhyavasini worship.

Name: Bara & Chota Sthambh / Historical sites in Bundelkhand
Accessibility: Some climbing and uneven terrain; partial accessibility
Guided Tours: Local guides and heritage walk operators
Parking: Public parking near the entrance
Nearby Amenities: Heritage hotels, riverfront eateries, local markets
Special Notes: Orchha palace complex is a Bundelkhand highlight.

Name: Lucknow — British Residency
Nearest Airport: Chaudhary Charan Singh International Airport (approx. 20–25 km)
Accessibility: Ruined structures with pathways; variable accessibility
Guided Tours: Heritage guides available
Parking: Nearby paid parking
Special Notes: Important 1857 rebel history site.
